section.title: Getting Started
section.para: The OSATE Graphical Editor allows viewing and manipulating AADL declarative models in a graphical way.

section.title: Creating a new AADL Package
section.para: A new AADL package and an associated diagram can be created by using a wizard.

listitem.para: Open the new file dialog by selecting File->New->Other...
Enter a name for the new package.
Select the AADL Project to create the package inside.

section.para: The new package will appear in the graphical editor.

section.title: Opening an Existing AADL Model
section.para: An existing AADL model can be opened in the graphical editor. Changes made to either the AADL source or the diagram will be reflected in the other.

listitem.para: Open an existing AADL source file.
Right click the AADL package or component in the Outline view.

Select Open Package Diagram for the package that contains the element. Select Open Classifier Diagram to open the diagram for the selected classifier. The diagram will be created if one does not already exist.

section.para: The diagram for the element will appear in the graphical editor.

section.title: Notes
section.para: Project->Build Automatically must be enabled. If it is not enabled, the graphical editor will not function properly.
The OSATE Graphical Editor stores diagrams in files with names based on UUID's. Eclipse's Project Explorer view will show the title of the diagrams instead of the filenames.
